DataElement.preferredName: Patient Thymidylate Synthase Eligibility Determination Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a condition or state related to a person receiving medical attention, care, or treatment, criteria to determine their eligibility for medical care programs and services in relation to the human thymidylate synthetase protein (312 aa, 36 kDa) which is encoded by the human (TYMS) gene.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person receiving medical attention, care, or treatment, criteria to determine their eligibility for medical care programs and services in relation to the human thymidylate synthetase protein (312 aa, 36 kDa) which is encoded by the human (TYMS) gene.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Human thymidylate synthetase protein (312 aa, 36 kDa) is encoded by the human (TYMS) gene. The protein is a conserved transferase enzyme that catalyzes methylene tetrahydrofolate (MTHF)/dUMP conversion to dihydrofolate/dTMP in thymidine triphosphate/deoxyribonucleotide biosynthesis. Thymidylate synthetase competes with the methylene tetrahydrofolate receptor for MTHF and maintains the dTMP pool for DNA replication and repair.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Thymidylate synthetase protein (312 aa, ~36 kDa) is encoded by the human TYMS gene. The protein is a conserved transferase enzyme that catalyzes methylene tetrahydrofolate (MTHF)/dUMP conversion to dihydrofolate/dTMP in thymidine triphosphate/deoxyribonucleotide biosynthesis. Thymidylate synthetase competes with the methylene tetrahydrofolate receptor for MTHF and maintains the dTMP pool for DNA replication and repair.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
